required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Arm and Putter Movement in Golfers With Golfer's Cramp
clinical_study.official_title: Golfer's Cramp: Correlation of Wrist Movements and Surface EMG With Putter Movements

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators will investigate golfers with visual evidence of an involuntary movement while putting before and after treatment with a low dose of propranolol.

detailed_description.textblock:
Dystonia affecting athletes has received little research attention and there has been a lack of awareness or interest among both physicians and athletes. Task-specific dystonias or occupational cramps affect people while writing, typing, and or playing a musical instrument. Our group has previously shown that a subset of golfers who complain of the yips appear to have a task-specific dystonia or golfer's cramp. The yips are characterized by an inability to appropriately complete a golf stroke, most often putting and chipping strokes. Most individuals with the yips describe a jerking or shaking movement that interrupts their swing. In many cases the yips are disabling and the golfer, including professional tour players, give up golfing.
Golfers who have evidence of golfer's cramp will putt a series of putts during which they will be monitored for arm movements and putter movements. They will then be treated with a low dose of propranolol to see if there is a change in these parameters.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Dynamic Change of Rotation at Impact
primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, approximately 45 minutes after propranolol dosing
primary_outcome.description: "Dynamic change of rotation at impact" is the velocity of rotation of the putter from the start of the forward swing until the time of impact with the golf ball.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Total Putter Face Rotation Before Impact
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, approximately 45 minutes after propranolol dosing
secondary_outcome.description: "Total putter face rotation before impact" is the degrees of rotation of the putter from the start of the forward swing until the time of impact with the golf ball.

arm_group.description: Subjects in this arm will be tested with the Opal device, the Science and Motion PuttLab (SAM), and the Surface Electromyography (EMG) to collect movement parameters while putting before and after a single dose of 10 mg Propranolol.

Subjects in this arm will be tested with the Opal device, the Science and Motion PuttLab (SAM), and the Surface Electromyography (EMG) to collect movement parameters while putting. The subjects in this arm will not receive any study drug.

intervention.description: Single oral dose of 10 mg propranolol
The Opal Device (APDM, Inc.) will be used to measure wrist movement.
The SAM will be used to study putter stroke movement and ball movement.
The surface EMG will be used to evaluate co-contraction of the wrist flexor/extensor muscle groups and the wrist pronator/supinator muscle groups.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- Age 18-75
- Complaint of golfer's cramp/yips
- Visual evidence of a movement disorder during putting
- Able to complete 80 putts during the session
Exclusion criteria:
- Contraindication to treatment with propranolol
- Movement disorder not when putting

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were recruited from Mayo Clinic in Arizona.

group.title: Golfers With Golfer's Cramp
group.description: Subjects in this arm will be tested with the Opal device, the Science and Motion PuttLab (SAM), and the Surface Electromyography (EMG) to collect movement parameters while putting before and after a single dose of 10 mg Propranolol.

group.title: Golf Pros
group.description: Subjects in this arm will be tested with the Opal device, the Science and Motion PuttLab (SAM), and the Surface Electromyography (EMG) to collect movement parameters while putting. The subjects in this arm will not receive any study drug.

outcome.title: Mean Dynamic Change of Rotation at Impact
outcome.description: “Dynamic change of rotation at impact” is the velocity of rotation of the putter from the start of the forward swing until the time of impact with the golf ball.
outcome.time_frame: baseline, approximately 45 minutes after propranolol dosing
outcome.population: This variable was measured at baseline and then again approximately 45 minutes after propranolol in the group with golfer's cramp on the same day. The pro golfers did not take propranolol so they were only tested once, at baseline.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
